Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2008 05:05AM kcq wrote: Hey Deb- I, too was an ativan virgin until I was DX.  I, too, started out by taking only 1/4 of a pill.  As time went on, I was able to take a full pill.  I ONLY take it when I need it.  I took one EVERY morning before chemo.  Let me tell you, Ativan became my BEST friend.  It did more for me than the anti nausea meds and pain meds.  I do not take medicine well, so the ativan was a true help to me.  good luck.
Posts.Title: ativan virgin... AlaskaDeb tooyoungtohavebc

Posts.Title: Do I need to ask onc for a bone scan? kcq Lynn12

Posts.Content: May 8, 2008 06:27AM kcq wrote: I have never had a bone scan (one year survivor).  I was really wanting to have one done, but I dont want my onc to think that I am being a hypocondriac.  But, I have had severe lower back pain for two years now.  Bowels have changed tremendously.  It is always watery and without form (sorry- TMI)  But anyway, while I was on chemo, the pain went away.  Now off of chemo, it is back and has moved into both sides of my hips.  I always thought that it was a herniated disk, so I never went to the doctor.  But now that I have been DX with cancer, I cant help but wonder if something else is going on.  Do most of you women have regular bone scans?  Thanks

Posts.Content: kcq wrote: Hi everyone- Hope I am posting on the right thread.  I just have a questions for anyone who has had bone mets.  In a nutshell---about two years ago, my lower back starting hurting.  The pain is so severe that I would wake up all night long.  It was difficult for me to do regular activities.  I have thrown it off as maybe a herniated disk.  I just have never gone to the dr.  Then, a year ago, I found out that I have BC.  HAve been through surgeries and treatments.  While on chemo, my back pain went away.  But is now back.  I had a DIEP surgery and the ONLY thing that hurt severely was my lower back.  The pain has now gone into my side hips.  Now that I have been DX with cancer, I am fearful that this pain is something else.  It has been CONSTANT for two years now (except during chemo).  It is EVERYDAY.  Plus, my bowels have changed drastically.  No blood, but I never have hard stools, it is always watery and has been for two years.  Sorry to be so graphic, but has anyone experienced this?  I am fearful to tell my onc in fear that he will think that I am just being obsessed.  Should I ask for a bone scan?  Or could this just be a herniated disk?  Thanks so much for any thoughts. Kim Kim Dx 5/1/2007, ILC, 4cm, Stage IIB, 1/4 nodes, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
